section.title: Prep Plan
content:
Here's a prep schedule table for the two dishes: | Day | Wild Rice Soup | Broccoli Rabe | |-----|----------------|---------------| | Sunday Night | - Chop mushrooms, onion, celery, carrot, garlic and store separately in airtight containers | No prep needed | | Monday | No prep needed | No prep needed | | Tuesday | No prep needed | No prep needed | | Wednesday | - Make complete soup through step 5 (before adding sour cream)
- Store in airtight container in refrigerator | - Trim stems and wash broccoli rabe
- Store wrapped in paper towels in produce bag | | Thursday | - Reheat soup gently on low
- Complete step 6 (add sour cream)
- Finish with fresh herbs for serving | - Complete all cooking steps 2-7 just before serving
- Time this about 15-20 minutes before mealtime | Key timing notes: - The soup actually benefits from being made ahead as flavors develop - Broccoli rabe should be cooked just before serving for best texture and color - Wednesday prep work will make Thursday much more manageable

content:
# Pressure Cooker Mushroom and Wild Rice Soup

## Ingredients
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 1 yellow or red onion, minced
- 2 pounds mixed mushrooms (cremini and shiitake), chopped into 1/2-1 inch pieces
- Kosher salt and black pepper
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 1 large carrot, peeled and chopped
- 6 garlic cloves, smashed and chopped
- 3 sprigs fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 5 cups vegetable or chicken stock
- 1/2 cup dry white wine
- 1 cup wild rice (about 6 ounces)
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- Chopped scallions or chives and fresh dill, for topping

## Steps
1. Turn on sauté setting on 6-8 quart pressure cooker. Melt butter and add onion. Cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.

2. Add mushrooms and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook until mushrooms release liquid and shrink, about 8 minutes. Add celery, carrot, garlic, thyme, garlic powder and black pepper. Stir in flour until vegetables are evenly coated.

3. Pour in stock and wine, turn off heat. Scrape bottom of pot thoroughly. Stir in wild rice.

4. Cook on high pressure for 10-12 minutes. Let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, then release remaining pressure manually.

5. Check rice texture; if needed, pressure cook 2 more minutes and quickly release pressure. For thicker soup, use sauté function to reduce to desired consistency.

6. Whisk sour cream with a few spoonfuls of warm soup in a small bowl, then stir mixture into soup. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

7. Serve topped with scallions/chives and dill. Reheat leftovers on low to prevent sour cream from breaking.

Note: To substitute wine, use 1/4 cup additional stock/water plus 2 teaspoons white wine vinegar or lemon juice.
# Broccoli Rabe

## Ingredients
- 1 bunch broccoli rabe
- 3-4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- Salt to taste
- Black pepper to taste

## Steps
1. Trim about 1 inch off the stems of the broccoli rabe and discard any yellowed leaves. Wash thoroughly and shake off excess water.

2. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add broccoli rabe and blanch for 1-2 minutes until bright green and slightly tender.

3. Drain immediately and place in ice water to stop the cooking process. Drain again and pat dry.

4. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced garlic and red pepper flakes, cooking until garlic is light golden, about 1-2 minutes.

5. Add the blanched broccoli rabe to the skillet. Season with salt and black pepper.

6. Sauté for 3-4 minutes, tossing occasionally, until the broccoli rabe is tender but still has some bite.

7. Serve hot as a side dish, drizzling with additional olive oil if desired.
